column4: No trucks allowed

column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column4: Buggy warning
column8: Stop ahead

column4: white triangles.
column8: green rectangles.

column4: No U-turns

column8: Drivers must turn right

column4: No U-turn
column8: Sharp curve ahead

column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: there is an intersection ahead.

column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column4: a winding road.
column8: a low place in the road.

column8: Lane closed for traffic

column2: 13. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: stop if necessary.
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Divided highway ahead.

column4: the law.
column8: what is not allowed.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 16. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: not turn right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 18. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Warning: hospital ahead.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column4: they must stop at the next intersection.
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 21. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column4: Crash-Prevention Driving
column8: Defensive Driving

column2: 22. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column4: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: flash your headlights.
column10: turn your head and look through the rear window.

column2: 24. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: at intersections.
column8: on narrow roads.

column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 26. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Both.
column8: The other driver.

column2: 27. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: once you have moved into the exit lane.

column2: 28. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 30. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column8: you must do it.
column10: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 31. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 32. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column8: you cannot pass.

column2: 33. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column10: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots

column2: 34. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 35. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: your own reaction time.
column8: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column10: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 36. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column6: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column8: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column10: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.

column2: 37. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
column8: speed up.

column2: 38. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: signal.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 39. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: must make a U-turn and then turn right.

column2: 40. When traveling on a highway divided into four traffic lanes, which vehicles are required to stop for a school bus that has stopped to unload children?
column4: All vehicles approaching the bus from either direction.
column6: No one is required to stop unless children are in view.
column8: All vehicles may pass the bus after providing an audible signal.
column10: Only vehicles approaching the rear of the bus traveling in the same direction as the bus.
